answer: I shall observe the tenets of Taekwondo

extra.prompt: How should your feet be positioned in an Attention Stance (Charyot Sogi)
extra.answer: Heels touching to form a 45 degree angle

extra.prompt: How big should a parallel stance (Narani Sogi) be, and how should the weight be distributed?
extra.answer: A shoulder width between outside of feet, weight 50/50

extra.prompt: How big should a sitting stance (Annun Sogi) be, and how should the weight be distributed?
extra.answer: One and a half shoulder widths between big toes, weight 50/50

extra.prompt: How big should a walking stance (Gunnun Sogi) be, and how should the weight be distributed?
extra.answer: One shoulder width wide (sideways), one and a half shoulder widths long between the big toes, weight 50/50

extra.prompt: How big should an L stance (Niunja Sogi) be, and how should the weight be distributed?
extra.answer: One and a half shoulder widths long in total, gap of 2.5cm, weight 70/30

Chon-Ji literally means 'heaven and earth', in the Orient it is interpreted as the creation of the world or the beginning of human history, therefore, it is the initial pattern played by the beginner. This pattern consists of two parts, one to represent heaven and the other, the earth

questions.prompt: How many movements does Chon-Ji have?

questions.answer: Yellow signifies the earth from which the plant sprouts and takes root as the Taekwondo foundation is being laid

extra.prompt: What does a pattern consist of?
extra.answer: A pattern consists of a combination of full power Taekwondo techniques against an imaginary opponent, designed to practice and perfect techniques, some of which might not otherwise be used

extra.prompt: The name of a pattern, the number of movements, or its diagram symbolises...
extra.answer: Either historical figures in Korean history, or instances relating to historical events

extra.prompt: What do the pattern meanings also demonstrate?
extra.answer: Pattern meanings demonstrate the use of one or more of the tenets, to give us inspiration to follow

extra.prompt: Why are Saju Jirugi and Saju Makgi not patterns?
extra.answer: They do not have meanings

extra.prompt: What two stances are in Chon-Ji? (In Korean)
What two blocks are in Chon-Ji? (In Korean)
Step turning
extra.answer: Omgyo Didimyo Dolgi

questions.answer: Dan-Gun is named after the Holy Dan-Gun, the legendary founder of Korea in the year 2333 BCE

questions.prompt: How many movements does Dan-Gun have?
What does three step sparring improve?

questions.answer: The plants growth as Taekwondo skills begin to develop

extra.prompt: What is free sparring?
extra.answer: The aim in free sparring is to score points and are using Taekwondo as a sport. The objective is to only touch your partner without causing any pain or injury. No techniques are allowed below the belt or to the back. As well as developing focus, distance and timing, free sparring improves awareness and encourages agility along with spontaneous reaction. The scoring system awards 1 point for a hand technique to the middle or high sections, 2 points for a middle section kick and 3 points for a high kick to the head

extra.prompt: Counting in Koran
extra.answer: As in English, the word for the double figure is placed in front of the single figure word, e.g. Twenty One = Sumul Hana, Twenty Two = Sumul Dool. Unlike our own decimal system, Korean counting is based on the number 9

extra.prompt: Count from 1 to 10 in Korean
Count from 10 to 50 in Korean, in multiples of 10
When can punches and strikes be used?
extra.answer: Punches and strikes can be used against hard or soft targets. The aim is to smash, pierce, or penetrate. This is achieved by focusing the breathing and the other elements of power to the end of the technique. Both techniques accelerate in a relaxed manner throughout the execution, ending with a dynamic twist with tension

extra.prompt: When can thrusts be used?
extra.answer: Thrusts are only used against soft targets. This technique reaches the target under tension and at a constant speed after its initial acceleration, exhaling throughout. This means they are effective anywhere on the line of attack

questions.answer: Do-San is the pseudonym of the patriot Ahn Chang-Ho, who devoted his entire life to furthering the education of Korea and its independence movement.

questions.prompt: How many movements does Do-San have?

questions.answer: Normal motion is performed at normal speed with a pause long enough to show when one move has completely finished and the next is about to begin. It has one sine wave movement and one breath for each technique.

extra.prompt: Release from grab
extra.answer: Jappyosul Tae

extra.prompt: Spot turning
extra.answer: Gujari Dolgi

extra.prompt: What is continuous motion?
extra.answer: When two or more moves are linked by one continuous breath

extra.prompt: In a right stance, a right technique is...
extra.answer: Obverse

extra.prompt: In a right stance, a left technique is...
extra.answer: Reverse

extra.prompt: All stances to the side are...
extra.answer: Neither left or right, therefore are neither obverse or reverse

extra.prompt: If the right leg is forwards in a 50/50 weight ratio stance, is it a left or right stance?
extra.answer: Right

extra.prompt: If the left leg is forwards in a 50/50 weight ratio stance, is it a left or right stance?
extra.answer: Left

extra.prompt: If the right has more weight in an unequal weight ratio stance, is it a left or right stance?
extra.answer: Right

extra.prompt: If the left leg has more weight in an unequal weight ratio stance, is it a left or right stance?
extra.answer: Left

questions.answer: Won-Hyo was the noted monk who introduced Buddhism into the Silla Dynasty in the year 686 CE

questions.prompt: How many movements does Won-Hyo have?

questions.answer: Blue signifies the heaven towards which the plant matures into a towering tree as training in Taekwondo progresses

questions.prompt: What are the components of the theory of power

extra.prompt: What is Reaction Force?
extra.answer: Using their force, striking when your opponent moves in

extra.prompt: What is Concentration?
extra.answer: Directing power to a small target area, tension for a split second

extra.prompt: What is Equilibrium?
extra.answer: Balance and stability, using your reaction arm for dynamic stability

extra.prompt: What is Breath Control?
extra.answer: Utilising the breath, tense abdomen to breathe out on impact

extra.prompt: What is Mass?
extra.answer: Using the knee spring and hip twist to increase body weight on impact

extra.prompt: What is Speed?
extra.answer: Maximise speed, the most essential factor for power

extra.prompt: What is Fast Motion?
extra.answer: Two or more moves performed in 'double-time' due to the second sine wave only being half of the normal sine wave, as you have less time to utilise the full range of movement

extra.prompt: What is Connecting Motion?
extra.answer: Two or more moves performed within the same sine wave that are linked by breath. The first move sets up the opening for the second, therefore the first is always a block and the second move is an attack. However, there are some exceptions

extra.prompt: What is Slow Motion?
extra.answer: Used to show the practitioners movement, technique, breath control and timing. It demonstrates the synchronisation of hands, feet, eyes and breath, and is performed to the count of 4 seconds

extra.prompt: What is Pushing Motion?
extra.answer: A movement performed with no impact. This is because one does not intend to cause severe damage or trauma to the opponent when defending their attacks

questions.answer: It is the pseudonym of a great philosopher and scholar Yi I (1536 - 1584 CE) nicknamed the 'Confucious of Korea'. The 38 movements refer to his birthplace on 38 degrees latitude and the diagram represents a scholar
